item.title: Misconceptions About Nicotine Undermine Public Health Progress
item.description: A recent survey shows many doctors are unsure if nicotine causes cancer, impacting public health efforts. Nicotine itself isn't the main health concern in smoking; risks come from tobacco combustion. Nicotine replacements, like patches, are safe. Some doctors falsely fear products like e-cigarettes. This misunderstanding hinders patient care and harm reduction. Healthcare providers seek FDA guidance on safer smoking alternatives. Accurate education on nicotine is crucial to empower patients to make informed health decisions. (Published on May 23, 2025byiwf.org)
